author: Chris Tierney
message:
feat: implement WebGL renderer with full Frame spec support

- Complete WebGL 2 renderer using TWGL.js and SDF shaders
- All shapes: circles, rectangles, lines with visual parity
- Image support with correct positioning and transforms
- Tree-order rendering with smart consecutive batching
- Proper transparency with premultiplied alpha blending
- Sharp corners/line endings matching Canvas/SVG defaults
- Optional clear (preserveDrawingBuffer) for accumulation mode
- Test-app integration with WebGL renderer option

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

author: Chris Tierney
message:
feat: flexible test-app with configurable generator/renderer grid

- Unified harness module replacing 4 separate files
- Custom dropdown controls for scene, generators, renderers
- Multi-select with toggle for generators and renderers
- Query params: ?scene=X&generator=Y&renderer=Z (multiple allowed)
- Auto-redirect to explicit URL when params missing
- Dynamic NxM grid (generators as rows, renderers as columns)
- Consistent dropdown styling with blue highlights for selected items

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

author: Chris Tierney
message:
feat: bootstrap WebGL and WebGPU renderer packages with design docs

Add two new renderer packages with comprehensive design documentation:

WebGL (renderer-webgl):
- Dependencies: twgl.js, gl-matrix
- SDF-based rendering approach
- Context loss handling documented
- Buffer management strategy (256 initial, 2x growth)

WebGPU (renderer-webgpu):
- Dependencies: typegpu, gl-matrix
- SDF-based rendering (mirrors WebGL approach)
- Device loss handling documented
- Buffer management strategy (same as WebGL)

Both packages include:
- DESIGN.md with full implementation plan
- AGENT.md with sub-agent instructions
- Known limitations (transparency, future features)
- Placeholder src/index.ts

Updated:
- agents.toml with new package patterns
- ARCHITECTURE.md with GPU Renderers section

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

covering the line endpoints that previously overlapped the joint circles.

author: Chris Tierney
message:
refactor: simplify sketch module API

author: Chris Tierney
message:
fix: internalize DPR handling in canvas renderer

Canvas renderer's toViewportCoords() now handles DPR scaling internally.
Callers pass CSS pixel coordinates; the renderer scales to buffer coords.

This also fixes a bug where shapes appeared too small on high-DPI displays:
- getCanvasSize() was returning buffer dimensions (CSS  DPR)
- Viewport was being set to inflated dimensions
- Shapes now render at correct size, matching original Processing sketches

Changes:
- CanvasRenderer.toViewportCoords() scales input by DPR internally
- getCanvasSize() returns CSS dimensions, not buffer dimensions
- Removed manual DPR scaling from interaction handlers
- Updated comments to reflect CSS pixel coordinate space

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

author: Chris Tierney
message:
fix: add resolve.alias to Vite config for workspace package HMR

During development, changes to workspace packages (renderers, generators,
spec) were not being reflected in the browser. The optimizeDeps.exclude
config wasn't sufficient - Vite needed explicit resolve.alias entries
pointing to source files for proper HMR.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

- Pruning happens internally before returning

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

author: Chris Tierney
message:
feat: implement V1 resource management system with image support

Add blocking resource management for external resources (images).
Each renderer owns a ResourceManager<T> that fetches blobs and
applies renderer-specific post-processing.

Key changes:
- Add Image shape type to spec (url, position, width, height)
- Add ResourceManager<T> with getResource/markNeeded/pruneUnused/destroy
- Add ResourcePostProcessor<T> interface for renderer injection
- Add extractResourceUrls() utility for Frame traversal
- Make Renderer.render() async (returns Promise<void>)
- Add Renderer.destroy() for lifecycle cleanup
- Update BaseRenderer for async render loop
- Canvas: ResourceManager<ImageBitmap> with createImageBitmap/.close()
- SVG: ResourceManager<string> with createObjectURL/revokeObjectURL
- Add image() to both generators (parity)
- Add test image and visual verification in test-app

V1 constraints:
- Blocking: render() waits for all resources
- All-or-nothing: any resource failure fails the frame
- Each renderer owns its ResourceManager (no sharing)
- Diff-based disposal: resources removed from frame are disposed

Breaking changes:
- Renderer.render() now returns Promise<void>
- Renderer interface requires destroy() method

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

author: Chris Tierney
message:
fix: wrap shapes inside Groups with inline ChildMaterial nodes

Shapes inside Groups now correctly receive their material properties.
Previously, only direct Scene children were grouped by material - shapes
inside Groups were emitted as raw geometry, falling back to root defaults.

Added inline material wrapping in Group.frame() that creates unique
ChildMaterial nodes for shapes with material references, preserving
the material's fill, stroke, and strokeWidth properties.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

author: Chris Tierney
message:
feat: implement viewport coordinate system across all packages

Add center-origin, Y-up coordinate system with configurable scaling:

Spec:
- Add Viewport type (halfWidth, halfHeight, scaleMode)
- Update Frame to require viewport property
- Add viewport validation to validateFrame()

Renderer-common:
- Add computeViewportTransform() for Canvas transform calculation
- Supports fit/fill/stretch scale modes

SVG Renderer:
- Use native viewBox and preserveAspectRatio for scaling
- Y-flip via root group transform scale(1, -1)

Canvas Renderer:
- Manual viewport transform via computeViewportTransform()
- Y-flip via scale(sx, -sy)
- Query element size on each render (don't set it)

Generators:
- Procedural: Add viewport() and scaleMode() methods to Sketch
- Object: Scene constructor requires Viewport parameter

Test-app:
- Convert all coordinates to center-origin, Y-up system
- Add ResizeObserver for dynamic canvas buffer sizing
- CSS ensures SVG and Canvas scale together

170 tests pass, visual parity verified across all 4 renderers.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

author: Chris Tierney
message:
refactor: SceneObject base class with transforms for all scene objects

Design changes (three.js-inspired):
- SceneObject abstract base class provides position, rotation, scale
- Shapes (Circle, Line) extend SceneObject - have transforms directly
- Group extends SceneObject - has transforms, NO material property
- Shapes without material use Scene's default styles

This matches three.js patterns where:
- Object3D provides transforms for all objects
- Mesh has both transforms and material
- Group is purely organizational (no material)

API improvement - shapes can now be transformed directly:
```typescript
const circle = new Circle(0, 0, 10);
circle.position = { x: 50, y: 50 };
circle.material = redMaterial;
scene.add(circle);
```

Instead of requiring a Group wrapper for every transform.

- Updated AGENT.md with design decisions and class hierarchy
- Updated ARCHITECTURE.md with object generator patterns
- 163 tests passing, visual parity verified

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

author: Chris Tierney
message:
feat: implement transform support across all packages

- Add Transform type with 6-value 2D affine matrix [a,b,c,d,e,f] to spec
- Add Matrix2D type and matrix validation in validateFrame()
- Add translate(), rotate(), scale() APIs to procedural generator
  - Matrix helpers: identityMatrix, translateMatrix, rotateMatrix, scaleMatrix, multiplyMatrices
  - Transform state saved/restored with push()/pop()
  - Shapes wrapped in Transform nodes when matrix is non-identity
- Add Group class to object generator (three.js-style)
  - position, rotation, scale properties
  - computeMatrix() composes TRS in standard order
  - Groups can be nested and contain shapes
- Update SVG renderer: <g transform="matrix(...)"> for Transform nodes
- Update Canvas renderer: ctx.save()/transform()/restore() for Transform nodes
- Update test-app with transform examples: translate, rotate, scale compositions
- All 4 renderers produce identical visual output
- 155 tests passing

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

author: Chris Tierney
message:
docs: design transform representation for Frame spec

Research validated user opinions on transform design:
- Transform nodes distinct from Materials (validated with nuance)
- Transforms accumulate via matrix multiplication, no inheritance (strongly validated)
- Matrix as canonical form for render-focused IR (validated)

Selected: 6-value 2D affine matrix [a,b,c,d,e,f]
- No id attribute (transforms don't need references)
- Flexible nesting with Materials
- Compact forms deferred as future optimization
- Post-processor can merge sequential transforms

Updated documentation:
- ARCHITECTURE.md: pipeline, transforms, future optimizer
- spec/AGENT.md: transform guidance
- renderer-common/AGENT.md: future candidates

Decision graph: 28 nodes on feat/transforms branch

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

author: Chris Tierney

- Add docs/ARCHITECTURE.md for cross-cutting concerns (83 lines)

Structure:

verbose inline instructions, reducing main conversation context.

author: Chris Tierney
message:
feat: complete material system with TDD tests and three.js-style API

- Add comprehensive unit tests for both generators (92 tests total)
- ProceduralGenerator: fill()/stroke()/strokeWidth() create ChildMaterial nodes
- ProceduralGenerator: push()/pop() for nested material contexts
- ObjectGenerator: Fix API to use three.js-style material references
  - Materials are independent objects, not containers
  - Shapes reference materials via .material property
  - Generator transforms flat API to nested Frame IR tree
- Update test-app with visual pattern exercising all material features
- Update agents.toml to clarify API vs IR distinction
- All 4 renderer outputs visually identical (verified with Playwright)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

author: Chris Tierney
message:
feat: implement Material-based Frame spec with validation

Transform Frame from flat structure to Material-based tree for style inheritance.

Spec changes:
- Add RootMaterial (complete) and ChildMaterial (partial with ref) types
- Add validateFrame() for single-pass tree validation
- Add resolveMaterial() for style inheritance resolution
- Frame now uses root: RootMaterial instead of shapes: Shape[]

Generator changes:
- ProceduralGenerator emits Material tree, adds fill/stroke/strokeWidth methods
- ObjectGenerator (Scene) emits Material tree, adds fill/stroke/strokeWidth props

Renderer changes:
- Both renderers call validateFrame() before rendering
- Traverse Material tree with renderNode(), resolve styles per shape
- Shapes now rendered with material fill/stroke/strokeWidth

Safety:
- resolveMaterial() guards against empty ancestors array
- validateFrame() checks root has all required properties

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

author: Chris Tierney
message:
docs: add Material-based Frame spec design documentation

- Create comprehensive spec/README.md documenting:
  - Material-based tree structure (RootMaterial, ChildMaterial, Shapes)
  - Validation rules (single-pass, ancestor-only refs, unique IDs)
  - Style resolution algorithm
  - Design decisions and rationale
  - Future extensions (transforms, additional properties)

- Update generator READMEs with Material output sections:
  - Procedural: fill()/stroke() create Material nodes, push/pop mapping
  - Object: Material class provides style context for children

- Update agents.toml to be lightweight pointers to READMEs

- Sync decision graph with design decisions and implementation plan

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>

author: Chris Tierney
message:
feat: major architecture improvements across generators and renderers

Test App:
- Refactor to 2 generators + 4 harnesses with code display
- Remove old apps/ directory, add generators/ and harnesses/
- Show generator code and harness code separately

Renderers:
- Add @medli/renderer-common with BaseRenderer abstract class
- SVG and Canvas renderers extend BaseRenderer (shared loop/stop)
- Default to white background when backgroundColor undefined

Object Generator:
- Remove ObjectGenerator class - Scene IS the generator
- Scene implements Generator, pass directly to renderers
- Add SceneObject interface for extensible scene tree
- Background is optional via setBackground()/add()/remove()

Procedural Generator:
- Redesign with p5.js-style sketch pattern
- Pass draw function: new ProceduralGenerator((p) => p.background(color))
- Sketch context provides background() and time

Spec:
- Frame.backgroundColor is now optional

 Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
